xxl.core.spatial.geometries
Interface Geometry2D

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Geometry2D>, java.io.Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
Curve2D, GeometryCollection2D<T>, Line2D, LinearRing2D, LineString2D, MultiCurve2D<T>, MultiLineString2D<T>, MultiPoint2D<T>, MultiPolygon2D<T>, MultiSurface2D<T>, Point2D, Polygon2D, Surface2D
public interface Geometry2D
extends java.lang.Comparable<Geometry2D>, java.io.Serializable

This is the base interface of the geometry model in XXL. The model conforms to the geometry model of the OGC Simple Feature Specification for SQL (SFS) http://www.opengis.org which specifies spatial datatypes, as well as spatial predicates and operations on them.

The following figures give an overview of the SFS type hierarchy and its realisation in XXL.


The geometry model specified in the OGC Simple Features Specification.


The abstract geometry model in XXL.

The model provides exactly the functionality specified in the SFS, except for the method- names which have been adapted to Java conventions (e.g. dimensions() became getDimensions()).

For a concrete implementation of this geometry model have a look at the package xxl.connectivity.jts which provides the required functionality based on the Java Topology Suite API.

See Simple Feature Specification (pdf).

See Also:
xxl.connectivity.jts

Method Detail

getDimensions

int getDimensions()
The inherent dimension of this Geometry2D object, which must be less than or equal to the coordinate dimension. This specification is restricted to geometries in two-dimensional coordinate space.

Returns:
the dimension of this Geometry2D object

java.lang.String getGeometryType()
Returns the name of the instantiable subtype of Geometry2D of which this Geometry2D instance is a member. The name of the instantiable subtype of Geometry2D is returned as a string.

Returns:

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Returns true if this Geometry2D is the empty geometry . If true, then this Geometry2D represents the empty point set for the coordinate space.

Returns:
true if this Geometry2D is the empty geometry, otherwise false

isSimple

boolean isSimple()
Returns true if this Geometry2D has no anomalous geometric points, such as self intersection or self tangency. The description of each instantiable geometric class will include the specific conditions that cause an instance of that class to be classified as not simple.

Returns:
true if this Geometry2D has no anomalous geometric points, false otherwise

relate

boolean relate(Geometry2D other,
               java.lang.String intersectionPattern)
Checks if this Geometry2D is spatially related to another Geometry2D, by testing for intersections between the Interior, Boundary and Exterior of the two geometries as specified by the values in the intersectionPattern
Returns true if the elements in the DE-9IM IntersectionMatrix for the two Geometrys match the elements in intersectionPattern. The pattern is a 9-character string, with symbols drawn from the following set:
  • 0 (dimension 0)
  • 1 (dimension 1)
  • 2 (dimension 2)
  • T ( matches 0, 1 or 2)
  • F ( matches FALSE)
  • * ( matches any value)
For more information on the DE-9IM, see the OpenGIS Simple Features Specification.

Parameters:
other - the other Geometry2D
intersectionPattern - a Stringpattern
Returns:
true if this Geometry2D is spatially related to another Geometry2D as specified by the values in the intersectionPattern

distance

double distance(Geometry2D other)
Returns the shortest distance between any two points in the two geometries as calculated in the spatial reference system of this Geometry2D.

Parameters:
other - the other Geometry2D
Returns:
the shortest distance between any two points in the two geometries

buffer

Geometry2D buffer(double width)
Returns a geometry that represents all points whose distance from this Geometry2D is less than or equal to distance. Calculations are in the Spatial Reference System of this Geometry2D.

Parameters:
width - the maximum distance between a point inside the buffer and the geometry
Returns:
a geometry that represents all points whose distance from this Geometry2D is less than or equal to distance
